subject: Conference season is upon us!
header: We've got a lot of conferences all bunched up this summer; plan now, if you haven't already, to go support one or more of them, do a presentation, and learn from colleagues. One of the greatest strenghts of Perl is the community, and we build that through events all around the world!
If you've got a big Perl workshop or other event planned, make sure to let us know here at the Perl Weekly, so it can get listed.

entries.title: Perl in a Business Application - Musings of an Architect
entries.author: mikko_koivunalho
entries.text: Mikko talks about design and architecture, with a nod to Brooks; in the end, a success, but not quite as originally architected.

entries.title: Perl nested arrays
entries.text: A Redditor raises a question about nesting of arrays; raiph points out that Perl 5 and Perl 6 behave differently, with code samples. TIMTOWTDI, of course.

entries.title: perlcritic and allowing simple double sigils dereferencing
entries.author: luca_ferrari
entries.text: Perl::Critic::ProhibitDoubleSigils can be a bit too aggressive; consider ProhibitComplexDoubleSigils instead!

entries.title: Type::Tiny 1.2 Coming Soon
entries.author: toby_inkster
entries.text: Type::Tiny is a small class for writing type constraints, which can be used with Moose, Mouse, or Moo, or standalone. V1.2 has been under development for some time, and is close to ready!

entries.title: \d does not validate numbers
entries.author: ben_bullock
entries.text: \d does not always do what you expect; in a Unicode context, it will match on anything that is regarded as a numeral in Unicode!
